thread.title: DocuSign Shows Strong Demand, Closes Up 30%

title: DocuSign Shows Strong Demand, Closes Up 30%
text:
Home / Business / DocuSign Shows Strong Demand, Closes Up 30% DocuSign Shows Strong Demand, Closes Up 30% 3 hours ago Business
Updated April 27, 2018 4:29 p.m. ET
Electronic-signature expertise firm
DOCU 37.00%
jumped sharply in its market debut Friday, the most recent expertise agency to commerce greater on its opening day.
DocuSign’s share value Friday afternoon valued it at about $6.04 billion. The firm, based in 2003, was valued at $three billion in April 2015.
The firm’s closed up 37% to $39.73, above its already raised $29 initial-public-offering value.
DocuSign, which began operations in 2003, is the most recent so-called unicorn, or personal firm valued at $1 billion or extra, to make its market debut this yr, becoming a member of others comparable to Spotify Technology SA and Dropbox Inc. Another expertise firm, Smartsheet Inc., additionally had its market begin on Friday, and its shares rose 30% to $19.50.
DocuSign Chief Executive
Daniel Springer
mentioned he noticed buyers’ eagerness throughout the agency’s so-called IPO roadshow, the place it lays out its enterprise for buyers. “There weren’t a lot of hard questions,” he mentioned in an interview Friday on the Nasdaq’s headquarters. “Most people came in and I felt like they were selling us on why they’d be great investors.”
Investors are clamoring for stakes in newly public expertise corporations, evidenced by the splashy debuts of many such companies this yr, together with Dropbox Inc.,
Zscaler
